result.execSummary:
The defendant Audie A Draper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharge.
Defendant ordered to pay DNA surcharge and all other costs, penalties and surcharges and to be collected by the DOC from 25% of prison funds from sentence being served in case J-8789 and to result in a civil judgment upon release to extended supervision.

Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.
Court ordered sentence to be served in prison.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Audie A Draper

records.addlTxt: Payment plan created to reflect adjusted cycle due date according to payments received.  Payment plan created on 1/19/17, court ordered $10/monthly starting 3/1/17.

GRANTING request for extension, signed and filed. lms

Defendant's pro se request for payment plan.
Letter to defendant.

Defendant Audie A Draper in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Audie A Draper in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
  Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections not made.  Statements made by counsel and defendant.

The court ordered defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.  Court ordered sentence to be served in prison.

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharge.
Defendant ordered to pay DNA SURCHARGE AND all other costs, penalties and surcharges and to be collected by the DOC from 25% of prison funds from sentence being served in case J-8789 and to result in a civil judgment upon release to extended supervision.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed,
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;

Attorney Michael B. Plaisted in court, defendant Audie A Draper not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 10.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael B. Plaisted in court, defendant Audie A Draper not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 10. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 10.

Defendant Audie A Draper in court with attorney Michael B. Plaisted.  Defendant Audie A Draper in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DUGAN, Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Letter received from an in-custody (Oshkosh Correctional Institution) defendant who is requesting warrant be resolved.   Copy of letter forwarded to S. Schrader, DA's Office, for action.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
